Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Peter Heltzel, Micah Institute, New York Theological Seminary, 475 Riverside Drive, New York, NY 10115.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Jackson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Peter Heltzel, Micah Institute, New York Theological Seminary, 475 Riverside Drive, New York, N.Y. 10115.



Council Member Jackson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Comrie:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application nos. C 130118 ZSK shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related to Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application numbers N 130117 ZRK and C 130116 ZMK which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Grant of a Special Permit, Brooklyn (C130118ZSK, N 130117 ZRK and C 130116 ZMK )

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 18 Greenwich Ave., Community Board No. 2, Application no.  20135374 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 18 Greenwich Ave, Manhattan (20135374 TCM)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 46 Gansevoort Street, Community Board No. 2, Application no.  20135408 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 46 Gansevoort St, Manhattan (20135408 TCM)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving the granting of an exemption for real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the Real Property Tax Law, for the 2003 through 2008  assessment rolls for the parcel owned by the Foundation for Sephardic Studies, Inc. in the City of New York, borough of Brooklyn, designated on the tax map as block 07089, lot 07  in such borough, and the cancellation of  taxes, fines, penalties and interest remaining unpaid, and the making of appropriate correction of the subject assessment rolls, if, upon  accepting and reviewing the application or renewal application for such exemption, the Department of Finance is satisfied that such corporation would otherwise be entitled to such exemption if it had filed such application for exemption by the appropriate taxable status date, in accordance with, and upon the effective date of, the chapter law represented by Assembly Bill A. 7153.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving the granting of an exemption for real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of the Real Property Tax Law. (A.6706)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.514/S.3872, legislation which would amend the Real Property Tax Law to allow veterans in New York City to enjoy the full value of the Veterans’ Property Tax Exemption.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Veterans
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Allow veterans in NYC to enjoy the full value of the Veterans’ Property Tax Exemption. (A.514/S.3872)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to deactivating muni-meters when parking rules are not in effect or receipt paper is not available.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Deactivating muni-meters when parking rules are not in effect or receipt paper is not available.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign S.172, also known as the Stop Abuse and Fraud in Electronic Lending Act of 2013.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Stop Abuse and Fraud in Electronic Lending Act of 2013. (S. 172)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York City Housing Authority to withdraw from the Memorandum of Understanding with the New York City Police Department through which it funds law enforcement services for NYCHA residents and to invest the resulting savings into the capital needs of its developments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Urging NYCHA to withdraw from the Memorandum of Understanding with the NYPD.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to delay the release of any Requests for Proposals to lease land until residents have utilized Tenant Participation Activity funds to consult with legal and technical advisory staff to understand and respond to lease plans and resident feedback has been incorporated into these plans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to delay the release of any Requests for Proposals to lease land until residents have utilized Tenant Participation Activity funds.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Int No. 97-A, 45-3-0  (Negative: CMs Ignizio, Vallone, Jr., and Oddo)

LU No. 796 & Res No. 1762, 46-2-0 (Negative: CM Barron and Reyna)
LU No. 797 & Res No. 1763, 46-2-0 (Negative: CM Barron and Reyna)
LU No. 798 & Res No. 1764, 46-2-0 (Negative: CM Barron and Reyna)
LU No. 799 & Res No. 1765, 46-2-0 (Negative: CM Barron and Reyna)

LU No. 795 & Res No. 1761, 47-0-1 (Abstention: CM Lappin)

In regard to Int No. 434-A, the question being should the bill be passed the objection of the Mayor notwithstanding?:

Int No. 434-A (override vote), 45-3-0 (Negative: CMs Gentile, Nelson, and Weprin)

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda

Items.MinutesNote: Int No. 434-A was re-passed by the Council, notwithstanding the objection of the Mayor, and was thereby enacted into law.
